intro: Hachettea, commonly known as the hachettea palm, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Arecaceae. It is native to Madagascar and consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their pinnately compound leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Hachettea species typically grow in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Their ornamental value has led to some species being cultivated in tropical gardens.
